intro: Trichera leucantha, commonly known as the white trichera, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and have a soft, hairy texture. Trichera leucantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
